text:
org.apache.batik.css.parser.Parser.parseTerm throws a NumberFormatException


when a value of -2147483648 is given. This is because the sign is not parsed


as part of the integer value: Integer.parseInt("-2147483648") is ok, even


through Integer.parseInt("2147483648") is not:




               int s = (plus) ? 1 : -1;


               int val = s * Integer.parseInt(scanner.getStringValue());




Please note that the stylesheets generated by MS Word for HTML conversions


have this extreme value for certain properties.
